name: Wyoming Inn of Jackson Hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reports on the Wyoming Inn we decided that this was the place to stay in Jackson Hole. We thought the price of $ 320 plus taxes was expensive, but based on the reviews felt that it must be worth it.
reviews.title: An expensive disappointment

reviews.text: It wasn't - we were very disappointed and kept asking ourselves whether this was the same property that we had read about. The room was comfortable but there wasn't any view. The Inn is located well away from downtown Jackson Hole in a retail strip. The breakfast, which received strong reviews was at best plain ordinary. The staff did their job as you would expected. Yes, there were little extras in the foyer, but at the end of the day you kept asking yourself whether this was good price value.
reviews.title: Beds More Comfortable Than At Home

likes.liked: — Plush beds, truly high speed internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt that in high summer they were "making hay while the sun shone".
reviews.title: Can't say enough of this gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid a hefty premium and left feeling that we had received very poor price/value. An expensive disappointment.
reviews.title: a great find

likes.liked: — nice big room with a Jaccuzzi tub

reviews.text: We stayed in the Wyoming Inn for three nights during the beginning of August. We thought the room had the most comfortable beds (two queens) that we have ever slept in - and we have a plush mattress at home. The continental breakfast in the mornings (including quiche that can be heated up in the microwave oven) was excellent. High speed internet was available at all times and was truly high speed. The only reason I did not give the hotel the highest rating was we experienced two false fire alarms very early in the morning on two separate days. When we checked out and mentioned to the desk clerk that the false alarms were the only problems we had, there was no explanation or apology, just an understanding chuckle.
reviews.title: Would love to stay here again!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Wyoming Inn for 4 nights in mid February 2006. We were surprised at the level of service for the price. The free hotel shuttle picked us up within 1/2 hr of placing the pickup call to them at the airport, dropped our bags in the immaculate lobby and we were checked in within 5 minutes. Our 3rd floor (top floor) room facing the busy highway was quiet,clean,equippped with a gas fireplace,jacuzzi tub and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Every morning they have some sort of FREE bagels,toast,coffee,tea,scrambled eggs,bacon or sometimes sausage, pancakes there for you on a simple buffet line. Joe the cook was a very friendly informative pleasant host every morning who we tipped well even though it was free. They even have free soup and or chili and fresh baked chocolate chip cookies every night at the buffet line when you come home at night. This hotel is service oriented and has an attentive friendly staff and is immaculately clean. The second floor features a loft with 2 computers and free internet access for guests. The only minus to the hotel is its on the outside edge of town too far away from the downtown Jackson square area to walk. The FREE city shuttle bus called the "start bus" has a convenient stop right behind the hotel near the Best Western Lodge at Jackson hole which will take you anywhere in town for FREE and runs basically every 30 mins or less. To go to the Teton Village ski area however the bus is $6 round trip. We loved this classy,clean small hotel and plan to be back in 2007. J. Kennedy
reviews.title: Great immaculate little hotel with friendly service
Heaven in Jackson
reviews.text: If you are looking for a great hotel at decent prices, this is it. Everything about it was first class.....remember it is a motel, so no valets, etc.
The employees from front desk to maids to breakfast employees, were all very warm and wonderful.
reviews.title: A great place (a review from the hotel room!)

reviews.text: They help you with everything, from directions to where to eat, what to visit, where to see animals, etc.
reviews.title: great value, better than expected

reviews.text: Don't miss this hotel/motel, its for all budgets. They have regular rooms (wonderful); they have fireplace rooms (wonderful I hear).
reviews.title: Exceptional
Wyoming Inn
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Wyoming Inn June 11-15. It was wonderful. I cannot say enough good things about this property. The staff was outstanding. Especially Debbie who allowed us to check in before the 4 pm time. Ed made excellent recommendations for places to eat nightly. The breakfast in the morning is far better than any continental breakfast elsewhere. They had quiche, biscuits and gravy, croissants, pastries, a wide variety of cereals and beverages. The room was spacious and clean. We had a window seat and a fireplace with jacuzzi. The hotel was quiet which made for a great nights sleep. We were within walking distance to Pizza Hut and Sidewinders. We were just down the way from the historic downtown area. If you plan to travel to Jackson in the future I highly recommend this hotel.
We visit Jackson every year. The Wyoming Inn is the best hotel to stay at in Jackson. It is close to town and convienent for all other activities. The rooms are beautiful and the breakfast is great!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so excited upon our arrival at the hotel. The lobby was beautiful, the staff were very friendly and the smell of fresh baked cookies was a very nice bonus. Then we got to the room - the smoke detector was dangling from the ceiling, a major light was broken, the bathroom door wouldn't stay shut, the sink's stopper was broken, the jacuzzi had a leak and wouldn't stay filled and then we discovered that the window crank was broken around 3 in the morning . But these were all minor problems compared to the air conditioning problem!
reviews.title: Looks apparently can be deceiving!

likes.disliked: — no air conditioner and no offer to compensate us

reviews.title: Relaxed atmosphere
reviews.text: The only night we got a good night's sleep was the first night because the air conditioner worked. The other 3 nights were miserable! We can understand that a broken air conditioner is out of their control and that they did install a new one as soon as they could. But that didn't help the fact that it was hot in our rooms. They told us to open the windows - thank goodness it was cold outside at night! BUT - we were on the main road side and the traffic NEVER stopped all night long! I paid alot of money for 3 sleepless nights. Then they finally installed the new air conditioning unit the last day of our stay. They guaranteed that the rooms would be cool but after an hour on 60 degrees, it never cooled down let alone got cold. We called the front desk and they said they would come check it out but never came!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We even paid extra to have a fireplace in our room but NEVER got to use it because of the air conditioning situation. If I have to pay that much money for a hotel room, I expect to have a top notch stay. But it wasn't the case here.
reviews.title: Fabulous small hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a five-day stay at the Wyoming Inn. Overall, it was a decent value for this time of year and for the area which is pretty expensive, but we noted some problems.
reviews.title: Lots of Pluses, Some Negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the positives... The breakfast, as others have said, is better than the usual "free" breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and attractive, and the public areas are quite nice. The front desk staff and breakfast staff were friendly. Other pluses are the soup offered in the afternoon (this is probably just a cooler weather offering), the drinks and fruit available all day. The free use of a computer was also very much appreciated.
reviews.title: Comfy stay

reviews.text: The location is outside town but convenient to the center by bus or car. We did walk into town several times, although it is over a mile in one direction. There is a free town shuttle bus which stops close to the hotel. If your schedule matches the bus schedule, that's a good option.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: The location can be a negative since it is directly on a busy road and has a car dealership to one side, a small strip mall to the other, and a car repair shop in back. Our windows had to be kept shut at night because of noise from the street, and, as others have noted, the heating system can be a problem because of overheating the room. Also, the soundproofing is not quite as good as at most hotels. When the occupant of the room next to us left and shut the door, it woke us on several occasions.
reviews.title: Nice room, but has major faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, I would say that I would try for a different hotel on a return trip, but for those seeking a good deal and who are not bothered by a busy location, the Wyoming Inn might be okay.
reviews.title: Perfect Way To Start A Vacation

reviews.text: A group of us from Ireland stayed here after arriving in Jackson hole without reservations in peak season, the staff were excellent and very accomodating.
reviews.title: Very Friendly

likes.liked: — Very friendly, homely not like a hotel stay!
likes.disliked: — Price as it was outside our budget but don't regret it at all

reviews.text: Freshly baked cookies in the evening and the breakfast was second to none.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming inn

reviews.text: A little more expensive than what we had budgeted for but having stayed there, worth the extra!
reviews.title: Gave us the flavor of the region

likes.liked: — The attention to detail, overall design of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay here and in the tetons/yellowstone, I will be back!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Wyoming Inn was a perfect end to our Yellowstone/Grand Teton trip and we enjoyed the amenities of this hotel after staying in the more spartan national park lodging. The Inn had well-decorated rooms with extremely comfortable beds. The extras included a great breakfast, snacks/drinks, free computer use, free use of a washer/dryer, free airport shuttle and the free town shuttle had a stop right next door. The employees were very welcoming and helpful. There is a Whole Foods Grocer in the shopping center next door. The Inn does not have a pool and it is on a busy street.
reviews.title: Loved it, great value

aka: Wyoming Inn Of Jackson Hole Hotel
description: As our guests we invite you to experience western elegance & luxury awaiting your arrival at the Wyoming Inn of Jackson Hole. Make yourself at home in our Grand Western Lobby with a wood burning fireplace and wild life art by award winning artist Thomas Mangelsen. Our guest rooms are beautifully appointed with western furnishings, flat screen TV’s, glass enclosed showers, granite counter tops, and cozy sitting areas. You’ll sleep peacefully on our Simmons pillow top mattresses dressed in lavish linens. Keuring coffee brewing systems along with a refrigerator and microwave provide additional comforts of home.Experience healthy and organic selections each morning in our Breakfast Restaurant with a menu created for your active lifestyle. Our Chef prepares daily breakfast specials that are certain to start your day perfectly. We are centrally located offering you convenient access to Jackson Hole activities that are sure to be on your agenda! Grand Teton National Park, Yellowstone National Park, and Jackson Hole Mountain Ski Resort are easily accessible. The Wyoming Inn is perfectly located for skiing, snowmobiling, wildlife viewing, hiking, fishing, rafting, and shopping.
